body_html:
Before you run dynamic_rnn, you can manually add static shape information to your inputs, i.e.

inputs.set_shape([None, None, input_depth])

where input_depth is a python int; and the first two dimensions are the unknown time & batch dimensions. If you have those, add them in as well.
body_text:
Before you run dynamic_rnn, you can manually add static shape information to your inputs, i.e.
inputs.set_shape([None, None, input_depth])
where input_depth is a python int; and the first two dimensions are the unknown time & batch dimensions.  If you have those, add them in as well.
body:
Before you run `dynamic_rnn`, you can manually add static shape information to your inputs, i.e.

`inputs.set_shape([None, None, input_depth])`

where input_depth is a python int; and the first two dimensions are the unknown time & batch dimensions.  If you have those, add them in as well.
